sections.title: config
description: This section will populate the .cfg file that will be passed to the instance with the -config flag

entries.name: hostname
entries.description: [R] hostname: The server instance name that will appear in game

entries.name: password
entries.description: [R] password: The user password for accessing the server

entries.name: password_admin
entries.description: [R] password_admin: The password admin uses to manage the server

entries.name: mission_template
entries.description: [R] mission_template: Filename of pbo in MPMissions folder

entries.name: config_template
entries.description: config_template: path of the custom template file for the cfg

sections.title: bat
description: This section will populate the run_server.bat file that will be used to start the instance

entries.name: server_title
entries.description: [R] server_title: The server instance name that will appear in the monitoring tool

entries.name: server_port
entries.description: [R] server_port: The port the server is running on

entries.name: server_max_mem
entries.description: [R] server_max_mem: The max memory that the server will be able to allocate

entries.name: server_config_file_name
entries.description: [R] server_config_file_name: The name of the config file, located in the instance folder

entries.name: server_cfg_file_name
entries.description: [R] server_cfg_file_name: The name of the cfg file, located in the instance folder

entries.name: server_flags
entries.description: server_flags: Default to empty, any addition flag to be passed to the server

entries.name: bat_template
entries.description: bat_template: path of the custom template file for the bat

sections.title: ODKSM
description: This section contains various settings required by the tool

entries.name: server_instance_name
entries.description: [R] server_instance_name: The name that will appear in the instance folder name

entries.name: user_mods_preset
entries.description: user_mods_preset: the path of an html preset generated by the Arma 3 launcher

entries.name: user_mods_list
entries.description: user_mods_list: the list of the user mods

entries.name: server_mods_list
entries.description: server_mods_list: the list of the server mods

entries.name: mods_to_be_copied
entries.description: mods_to_be_copied: a user or server mod that is also in this list will be copied instead of linked

entries.name: skip_keys
entries.description: skip_keys: which key will be skipped and not linked to the main Keys folder

entries.name: arma_folder
entries.description: arma_folder: The folder that contains the game, default to the steam default folder

entries.name: server_instance_root
entries.description: server_instance_root: every instance folder will be put in this root folder, default to :arma_folder:

entries.name: linked_mod_folder_name
entries.description: linked_mod_folder_name: the name of the linked mod folder

entries.name: copied_mod_folder_name
entries.description: copied_mod_folder_name: the name of the copied mod folder

entries.name: server_instance_prefix
entries.description: server_instance_prefix: every instance folder name will be prefixed by this

sections.title: mod_fix_settings
description: Settings required by specific ModFix module. Do note that if a module is enabled the relative settings MAY be [R].
Check each ModFix documentation for more information about their settings.

entries.name: enabled_fixes
entries.description: enabled_fixes: all enabled fix file names (without the .py); will automatically put these mods in mods_to_be_copied

entries.name: cba_settings
entries.description: [ cba_a3 ] cba_settings: Path of the custom cba_settings.sqf file

entries.name: instance_specific_cba
entries.description: [ cba_a3 ] instance_specific_cba: If True, the cba gets copied instead of symlinked and won't be touched by instance updates

entries.name: odkai_local_path
entries.description: [ odkai_local ] odkai_local_path: the full path of the folder containing the mod
